News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Q3FY26 Net Profit Drops 90%
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries reported Q3FY26 net profit of ₹11.55 crore, down 90% from ₹120.42 crore in Q3FY25. Revenue declined 11% to ₹1,328.58 crore.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Starts OPVC Pipes Production
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries commences commercial production of OPVC pipes, tubes, and fittings with 1200 tonnes annual capacity from February 2, 2026.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Promoters Encumber 31.09% of Their Shareholding
News.Summary: Promoters of Jai Balaji Industries Limited, led by Sanjiv Jajodia, have encumbered 31.09% of their total shareholding, affecting 59,15,20,230 shares. The encumbrance impacts multiple promoter entities including Sanjiv Jajodia, Rajiv Jajodia, and several associated companies, while promoters collectively hold 64.84% of the company's total share capital.

News.Title: Hariaksh Industries Pledges 85 Lakh Shares of Jai Balaji Industries to Tata Capital
News.Summary: Hariaksh Industries Private Limited has pledged 85,00,000 shares (0.93% of total share capital) of Jai Balaji Industries Limited to Tata Capital Limited as collateral for a loan taken by a third party. The pledge was created on November 24, 2025, reducing Hariaksh Industries' unencumbered holding in the target company from 2.35% to 0.93%.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Reports Sharp Decline in Q2 Financial Performance
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries posted Q2 net profit of 264.8 million rupees, down significantly from 1.53 billion rupees year-over-year, while revenue fell to 13.53 billion rupees from 15.56 billion rupees. The company's EBITDA dropped to 719.3 million rupees from 2.28 billion rupees, with EBITDA margin contracting to 5.31% from 14.66% in the same period last year.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Reports Q2 Results and Independent Director Cessation
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries Limited approved standalone and consolidated unaudited financial results for the quarter and half-year ended September 30, 2025, showing net profit of ₹26.48 crores for Q2 versus ₹153.16 crores in the same quarter last year. Mr. Ashim Kumar Mukherjee will cease as Independent Director on December 1, 2025, after completing two consecutive terms of 5 years each.

News.Title: Hariaksh Industries Pledges 45 Lakh Shares of Jai Balaji Industries to Tata Capital
News.Summary: Hariaksh Industries Private Limited has pledged 45,00,000 shares (0.49% of total capital) of Jai Balaji Industries Limited to Tata Capital Limited as collateral for a loan taken by a third party. The pledge was created on November 13, 2025, increasing Hariaksh's total encumbered shareholding in Jai Balaji Industries to 2,15,00,000 shares (2.35% of total share capital).

News.Title: Hariaksh Industries Pledges 1.7 Crore Shares of Jai Balaji Industries to Tata Capital
News.Summary: Hariaksh Industries Private Limited has pledged 1,70,00,000 shares (1.86% of total share capital) of Jai Balaji Industries Limited to Tata Capital Limited as collateral for a loan taken by a third party. The pledge was created on October 27, 2025. Hariaksh Industries holds 16 crore shares representing 17.54% stake in Jai Balaji Industries. The disclosure shows the current encumbrance status of all promoters and persons acting in concert, with several entities having previously pledged portions of their holdings.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Reports Sharp Decline in Q1 Financial Performance
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries reported significantly lower quarterly results with net profit falling to 705.5 million rupees from 2.09 billion rupees year-over-year. Revenue declined to 13.57 billion rupees compared to 17.2 billion rupees in the same period last year. EBITDA dropped to 1.27 billion rupees from 3.16 billion rupees year-over-year, while EBITDA margin compressed to 9.36% from 18.38% in the previous year.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Appoints New Independent Director and Approves Q1 FY2026 Results
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries Limited appointed Shri Parthasarathi Mukhopadhyay as Additional Director (Non-Executive Independent) for a two-year term from August 8, 2025 to August 7, 2027, subject to shareholder approval. The company also approved re-appointment of Shri Rajiv Jajodia and Shri Gaurav Jajodia as Whole-time Directors for three years from September 1, 2025 to August 31, 2028. The board approved unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, showing revenue from operations of ₹1,357.17 crores and net profit after tax of ₹70.55 crores. The company appointed M/s. MKB & Associates as Secretarial Auditor for five years from FY 2025-26 to FY 2029-30 and M/s. Mondal & Associates as Cost Auditor for FY 2025-26. Additionally, the board approved alteration in Articles of Association allowing the same individual to hold positions of Chairperson and Managing Director simultaneously.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Reports 66% Decline in Q1 Net Profit to ₹705.5 Million
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries reported quarterly net profit of ₹705.5 million compared to ₹2.09 billion in the same period last year, representing a significant decline. Revenue fell to ₹13.57 billion from ₹17.2 billion year-over-year. EBITDA decreased to ₹1.27 billion from ₹3.16 billion, while EBITDA margin compressed to 9.36% from 18.38% in the previous year.

News.Title: CRISIL Upgrades Jai Balaji Industries' Credit Ratings on Rs. 995 Crore Bank Facilities
News.Summary: CRISIL has upgraded the credit ratings for Jai Balaji Industries Limited's bank loan facilities totaling Rs. 995 crores. The long-term rating was upgraded to CRISIL BBB+/Stable from CRISIL BBB/Stable, while the short-term rating was upgraded to CRISIL A2 from CRISIL A3+. The rating upgrade affects the company's total bank loan facilities worth Rs. 995 crores.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries to Close Subsidiary in Uganda
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries has decided to shut down its subsidiary operation in Uganda. No further details about the reasons for the closure or its impact were provided in the given news snippet.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Reports Q4 Results and Diversification
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries announced its Q4 financial results, reporting a net profit of 755 million rupees, down from 2.73 billion rupees year-over-year and 1.2 billion rupees quarter-over-quarter. The company's revenue for Q4 stood at 15.9 billion rupees, a decrease from 18.46 billion rupees in the same quarter last year. Additionally, the company revealed plans to diversify its business by entering into the production of OPVC pipes, tubes, and fittings.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Expands into OPVC Pipe Business
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries has announced its entry into the business of OPVC (Oriented Polyvinyl Chloride) pipes, tubes, and fittings. This move represents a significant expansion of the company's product portfolio.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Reports Q4 Financial Results
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries has reported its Q4 financial results. The company's EBITDA decreased to 1.3 billion rupees from 2.41 billion rupees year-over-year. The EBITDA margin fell to 8.30% from 13.05% in the same period. Net profit declined to 755 million rupees from 2.73 billion rupees year-over-year and 1.2 billion rupees quarter-over-quarter. Revenue for Q4 was 15.9 billion rupees, down from 18.46 billion rupees in the previous year.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Reports Q3 Financial Results
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries has announced its financial results for the third quarter. The company reported a net profit of 1.2 billion rupees, which is a decrease from 2.3 billion rupees in the same quarter of the previous year. Revenue for Q3 stood at 15 billion rupees, slightly lower than the 15.39 billion rupees reported in the corresponding quarter last year.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Reports Decline in Q3 EBITDA and Margin
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries has reported a decrease in its third-quarter financial performance. The company's EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization) fell to 1.9 billion rupees from 2.47 billion rupees in the same quarter of the previous year. Additionally, the EBITDA margin declined to 12.79% from 16.04% year-over-year.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries Reports Decline in Q3 Net Profit
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries has reported its financial results for the third quarter. The company's net profit decreased to 1.2 billion rupees, down from 2.3 billion rupees in the same quarter of the previous year. Revenue also saw a slight decline, coming in at 15 billion rupees compared to 15.39 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: Jai Balaji Industries to Consider Q3 Results
News.Summary: Jai Balaji Industries has announced that it will consider its third quarter (Q3) financial results on February 11. This meeting is likely to review and potentially approve the company's performance for the quarter.
